danfulea.math

Class MathUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.math.MathUtil

  • public class MathUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Some math utilities such as base conversions, spline interpolations and number formatting. Some routines are based on EGSnrc MORTRAN code (NRC Canada).
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 15 APR. 2011

      • set_defaults

        public static void set_defaults()
        Default number format with 3 digits.

      • AINTP

        public static double AINTP(double X,
                           double[] XA,
                           int NX,
                           double[] YA,
                           int ISK,
                           boolean XLOG,
                           boolean YLOG)
        Linear interpolation based on EGSnrc fortran/mortran code.
        Parameters:
        X - the desired x-value
        XA - the known array of x-values
        NX - its dimension (length of the array)
        YA - the array of y-values.
        ISK - dummy variable having no use!!
        XLOG - true if we want logarithmic values for x-values
        YLOG - true if we want logarithmic values for y-values
        Returns:
        the desired y-value

      • set_spline

        public static void set_spline(double[] x,
                              double[] f,
                              double[] a,
                              double[] b,
                              double[] c,
                              double[] d,
                              int n)
        Sets cubic spline interpolation coefficients for the data contained in the array f(n) at the abscissas x(n). Based on EGSnrc fortran/mortran code.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-array data
        f - the y-array data
        a - the a coefficient array of n-1 dimension to be filled by this routine
        b - the b coefficient array of n-1 dimension to be filled by this routine
        c - the c coefficient array of n-1 dimension to be filled by this routine
        d - the d coefficient array of n-1 dimension to be filled by this routine
        n - the dimension of input arrays (x or y)

      • spline

        public static double spline(double s,
                            double[] x,
                            double[] a,
                            double[] b,
                            double[] c,
                            double[] d,
                            int n)
        Returns the value of the function at s using the spline coefficients a,b,c,d, which must have been set using set_spline
        Parameters:
        s - the value at which function is evaluated
        x - the x-array of dimension n
        a - the a coefficient array of n-1 dimension
        b - the b coefficient array of n-1 dimension
        c - the c coefficient array of n-1 dimension
        d - the d coefficient array of n-1 dimension
        n - the dimension of x-array
        Returns:
        the value of the function at s

      • gauss_legendre

        public static void gauss_legendre(double x1,
                                  double x2,
                                  double[] x,
                                  double[] w,
                                  int n)
        Given the lower and upper limit of integration, x1 and x2, and given n, this routine returns arrays x and w, containing the abscissas and weights of the Gauss-Legendre n - point quadrature formula
        Parameters:
        x1 - lower limit of integration
        x2 - uper limit of integration
        x - abscissas to be filled by this routine
        w - weights to be filled by this routine
        n - array dimension

      • format

        public static java.lang.String format(double d,
                                      int offset,
                                      boolean nrformat)
        Format a number d using either number format (true) or scientific format(false) and if its length is less then an offset value then remaining characters are filled with blank.
        Parameters:
        d - the number as a double
        offset - the offset
        nrformat - true if number format false if scientific
        Returns:
        the String representation of the formatted number

        Returns:

      • SIGMA

                         int MODE)
        Statistical routine based on EGSnrc MORTRAN code. Just for testing.
        Parameters:
        NDATA - NDATA
        ISTAT - ISTAT
        MODE - MODE

      • heap_sort

        public static void heap_sort(int n,
                             double[] rarray,
                             int[] jarray)
        Heap sort will sort the real array rarray of dimension n in ascending order and at the same time put into the integer array jarray the original position of the elements, e.g. if rarray was on input (5,14,8,2), it will be after completion of heap_sort (2,5,8,14) and jarray will be (4,1,3,2). heap_sort uses the heap sort algorithm, the implementation is based on hpsort from Numerical Recipies with a couple of modifications.
        Parameters:
        n - dimension of the array
        rarray - input array which will be sorted
        jarray - original indexes of input array
